meta.title: Home - Harrison Central School District

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasFooter fsHasOneColumnLayout home fsHasTheme2

div.p: The Harrison Central School District believes the most important endeavor of a community is the commitment of parents, community members, and educators to ensure an enriching and empowering education for all of its children.

The Harrison Central School District believes the most important endeavor of a community is the commitment of parents, community members, and educators to ensure an enriching and empowering education for all of its children.

The Harrison Central School District believes the most important endeavor of a community is the commitment of parents, community members, and educators to ensure an enriching and empowering education for all of its children.

HCSD's Fine and Performing Arts Department affords all students the opportunity to study music, visual art, dance, and theatre, providing every child with experiences that promote life-long participation and enjoyment of the arts. We embrace the cooperative work of parents, teachers, students, and the community, and are invested in a collaborative approach to support student development and success.

The Harrison Athletics program is built on the principles of Rigor, Development, Communication, and Accountability. Harrison coaches work to develop programs based on communication, clear expectations, ongoing feedback, accountability and developing self-advocacy in our student athletes. We are committed to meeting the standards of high expectation and maximum effort on and off the field.

div.class: fsElement fsResourceElement fsSlideshow universal-slideshow fsSlideshowHorizontal fsStatePlaying

figcaption.p: Dirty Rotten Scoundrels Opens at Harrison High School
Sara McSweeney, Nasia Meimeteas Named Regeneron Scholars
Debate Team Posts 7th Tournament Win; Senior Ava Zinman Ranked #1
Model Congress Team Earns Awards at Harvard Competition
High School Concerts Entertain and Amaze Audiences

section.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsSlideshow home-announcement fsThumbnailOriginal fsThumbnailSmall fsItemCount_5 fsSlideshowHorizontal

div.p: Our District has created Learning From Home, a collection of thoughtfully developed resources to guide student learning while our schools are closed. These webpages provide all the information that you and your child will need to access learning on a daily basis.

div.a: An Update from the Superintendent of Schools About the Coronavirus

div.p: The Harrison Central School District has created a Coronavirus webpage of resources and information for parents. The Distirct will continue to monitor guidance from the CDC, the Department of Health and the State Education Department and will update this webpage as information becomes available.
The February edition of Highlights is available for download. Celebrate our school community and, most especially, how our mission provides for our diverse learners to thrive.

These Board presentations spotlight instructional programs that illustrate Harrison's Core Values and Mission in Action. Each presentation showcases the implementation of the district's three strategic instructional priorities.

div.a: Private and Parochial School Applications for Transportation due April 15

div.p: The deadline for Applications for Transportation to Private and Parochial Schools for the 2020-2021 Year has been extended. Completed applications must be received by April 15, 2020. Completed applications must be mailed to Harrison Central School District, Transportation Office, 50 Union Avenue, Harrison, NY 10528 or emailed to barbagallog@harrisoncsd.org.

span.a: Application for Transportation to Private and Parochial Schools

img.alt: Model Congress Team Earns Awards at Harvard Competition

div.a: Model Congress Team Earns Awards at Harvard Competition

article.a: Read full story about Model Congress Team Earns Awards at Harvard Competition

div.p: HHS students in the graduating class of 2019 enrolled in one or more AP or IB course
Varsity sports teams have achieved New York Scholar-Athlete designation for the past 5 years, representing both academic and athletic excellence
2019 HHS graduates were admitted to institutions of higher learning, with 93% of students admitted to 4-year institutions

HHS is ranked among America’s Most Challenging High Schools by The Washington Post, recognized by Newsweek as one of America’s top high school’s, and ranked in the top 2% of schools in the nation by U.S. News & World Report
8th grade students who took the Algebra I Regents exam in 2019 earned Regents credit, and 57% scored at the mastery level with a score of 85 or higher
Harrison K-12 students are enrolled in at least one art class
Over the past three years, 95% of students with disabilities with a four-year graduation plan graduated on time

The Harrison Central School District believes the most important endeavor of a community is the commitment of parents, community members, and educators to ensure an enriching and empowering education for all of its children. Our learning community is committed to a mission of equity, access, rigor, and adaptability. These core values inform every aspect of our school district’s work.

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

article.h2: Update from the Superintendent of Schools

p.em: “It is when we are most lost that we sometimes find our truest friends.”

div.p: Dear Harrison Learning Community,

In Grimm’s fairytale, Snow White is cast asunder by an unloving stepmother, her world seemingly without hope, and then she finds her truest friends. Today Governor Cuomo announced schools will remain closed through May 15, yet another dispiriting pronouncement for your children to endure. If school reopens on the 15th your children will have missed nine weeks of school.
